urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text:
I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
The River Lugg, in Herefordshire, one of the most beautiful and important rivers in the UK, has been intentionally destroyed over a stretch of approximately 1.5km with huge repercussions for wildlife downstream üëá 

https://t.co/NKDHJhVn3s

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

Insane that when a concerted effort to repair our rivers is getting into its stride, that this sort of supersized ecological vandalism can still be happening. Hope the @EnvAgency throw the book at them. https://t.co/Vpvv6PYXgP

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

tweets.text: @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Beyond prosecution, there really needs to be some sort of restorative justice process. Fines may deter (if prosecution is successful), but this damage needs repairing and the environment repaired and encouraged to return - although that will take years.

Counting #salmon redds in Swindale Beck today with @EnvAgencyNW. Really decent numbers, with at least 43 redds seen in the 1km stretch at the bottom of the valley, and plenty further up too. Saw loads of big fish, dead & alive. #rivers https://t.co/CJviM1ZN7n

tweets.text: @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency This is a job for @NaturalEngland who are the regulator for SSSIs - although sadly understandable why many wouldn't know that... https://t.co/PqrO4Kja1D

Terrible to hear about this eco-vandalism at #RiverLuggSSSI in #Herefordshire

It's a clear breach of environmental legislation, and test case for @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency enforcement

We @WildlifeTrusts will be following it very carefully https://t.co/YZpRTggpl4

urls.title: Guest blog - How nature dies by Alistair Gammell - Mark Avery
urls.description: Alistair Gammell worked for RSPB for 40 years and was closely involved in the drafting of the Birds and Habitats Directives and for growing RSPB‚Äôs international work. He was RSPB‚Äôs first International Director and retired from RSPB in 2009. He then worked to successfully establish large scale fully protected marine reserves in the seas around the British Indian Ocean Territory and Pitcairn Island. He is a passionate nature conservationist and fly fisherman (alistairgammell@yahoo.co.uk) Oughton Head is a

tweets.text:
Guest Blog: How Nature Dies by Alistair Gammell https://t.co/TwtWsfjEUO

@EnvAgency @DefraGovUK https://t.co/j74RCIPMhH

Well done @JoRobb5 for co-ordinating the inaugural meeting of the Thames Valley Rivers Network this morning. Good to hear from @thameswater @EnvAgency and campaigners and discuss next steps in the fight for cleaner rivers with cllrs and officers from other local authorities.
